_comment_format: Each entry in 'gpio_configs' defines a GPIO line to monitor. Fields: 'name' = device tree GPIO line name, 'direction' = edge trigger (FALLING, RISING, or BOTH), 'target' = systemd unit to activate on event, 'continue' = keep monitoring after first event (true for presence pins).

gpio_configs._comment: Power button -- active low, trigger on press (falling edge). Activates the systemd target that handles a short power button press (toggle chassis power state).
gpio_configs.name: POWER_BUTTON

gpio_configs._comment: Reset button -- active low, trigger on press (falling edge). Activates the systemd target for a warm reset of the host.
gpio_configs.name: RESET_BUTTON

gpio_configs._comment: Chassis intrusion switch -- monitor both open and close. The RISING edge (switch open = intrusion detected) starts the handler target; the FALLING edge (switch closed = chassis sealed) stops it.
gpio_configs.name: CHASSIS_INTRUSION

gpio_configs._comment: NIC 0 presence detect -- active low (asserted when NIC is inserted). Monitor both edges so inventory is updated on both hot-plug insert and removal. 'continue' is true for ongoing runtime presence tracking.
gpio_configs.name: NIC0_PRSNT_N
